---
id: pix-brcode-parse-cobv-json
title: "Load, validate and parse the COBV json payload"
description: "Load the COBV DynamicBRCode payload, do all security validations and parses the contents to the json format."
sidebar_label: "Load, validate and parse the COBV json payload"
hide_title: true
hide_table_of_contents: true
api: 
sidebar_class_name: "get api-method"
info_path: reference/pix-indirect/btg-pactual-banking-as-a-service-pix-indirect-participant
custom_edit_url: null
proxy: https://proxy.writechoice.io/
---

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Load, validate and parse the COBV json payload"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"get"}
  path={"/pix/brcode/dynamic/payload/cobv/{url}"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Load the COBV DynamicBRCode payload, do all security validations and parses the contents to the json format.
> The URL value must be URLEncoded.

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={[{"examples":{"BtgPactualPayloadUrl":{"value":"api.sandbox.developer.btgpactual.com/v1/p/d/c0afe38fe41d4778b9e08d1c815baf83"}},"name":"url","description":"The json payload url without the 'https://' prefix.\n\n> The URL value must be URLEncoded.","schema":{"type":"string"},"in":"path","required":true},{"examples":{"CodMun":{"value":"3550308"}},"name":"CodMun","description":"Code based on the IBGE Municipal Code Table that presents the list of Brazilian cities associated with 7 digits code, the first two referring to the code of the Federation Unit.","schema":{"type":"string"},"in":"query"},{"examples":{"DPP Example":{"value":"2021-01-01"}},"name":"DPP","description":"Desired payment date. In a format yyyy-mm-dd, according to ISO 8601.","schema":{"type":"string"},"in":"query"}]}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={undefined}
>
  
</RequestSchema>

  id={undefined}
  label={undefined}
  responses={{"200":{"content":{"application/json":{"schema":{"title":"Root Type for BRPayloadJsonResponse","description":"","type":"object","properties":{"body":{"description":"The json payload.","title":"Payload Json Debt Collection","required":["txid","calendario","revisao","status","valor","chave","devedor","recebedor"],"type":"object","allOf":[{"type":"object","properties":{"calendario":{"title":"Calendar","description":"The fields nested under the calendar identifier organize information regarding collection time control.","allOf":[{"title":"Creation","required":["criacao"],"type":"object","properties":{"criacao":{"format":"date-time","title":"Creation Date","description":"Timestamp that indicates the moment when the collection was created. It respects the format defined in RFC 3339.","type":"string"}}},{"title":"Presentation","required":["apresentacao"],"type":"object","properties":{"apresentacao":{"format":"date-time","title":"QR Code Presentation Timestamp","description":"Timestamp which indicates the time at which the JSON payload representing the debt was recovered. That is, ideally, it is the moment when the user made the capture of the QR Code to verify the payment data. It respects the format defined in RFC 3339.","type":"string"}}},{"title":"Expiration Date","required":["dataDeVencimento","validadeAposVencimento"],"type":"object","properties":{"dataDeVencimento":{"format":"date","title":"Collection due date","description":"This is a date, in the format `yyyy-mm-dd`, according to ISO 8601. It is the expiration date of the collection. The collection can be honored until that day, including at any time of the day.","type":"string","example":"2020-04-01"},"validadeAposVencimento":{"format":"int32","title":"Validity after expiry","description":"This is the number of calendar days after the due date when the collection can be paid. Case Once this period has expired and the charge has not been paid, it will remain ACTIVE.","default":"30","type":"integer"}}}]},"devedor":{"oneOf":[{"title":"Natural Person","required":["cpf","nome"],"type":"object","properties":{"cpf":{"allOf":[{"title":"CPF","pattern":"/^\\d{11}$/","type":"string"},{"description":"CPF of the borrower or 'drawee'."}]},"nome":{"title":"Name","description":"Name of the borrower or 'drawee'.","maxLength":200,"type":"string"}}},{"title":"Legal Person","required":["cnpj","nome"],"type":"object","properties":{"cnpj":{"allOf":[{"title":"CNPJ","pattern":"/^\\d{14}$/","type":"string"},{"description":"CNPJ of the borrower or 'drawee'."}]},"nome":{"title":"Name","description":"Name of the borrower or 'drawee'.","maxLength":200,"type":"string"}}}],"description":"The fields nested under the borrower object are optional and identify the borrower, that is, the person or the institution to which the debt is addressed. It does not necessarily identify who will effectively make the payment. A CPF may be the borrower of a debt, but it may happen of another CPF to effectively pay the document. It is not allowed that the field devedor.cpf and devedor.cnpj field are filled at the same time. If the devedor.cnpj field is then the devedor.cpf field cannot be filled, and vice versa. If the field devedor.nome is filled in, so it must exist either a devedor.cpf or a devedor.cnpj field filled."}}},{"required":["logradouro","cidade","uf","cep"],"type":"object","properties":{"recebedor":{"oneOf":[{"title":"Natural Person","required":["cpf","nome"],"type":"object","properties":{"cpf":{"allOf":[{"title":"CPF","pattern":"/^\\d{11}$/","type":"string"},{"description":"CPF of the borrower or 'drawee'."}]},"nome":{"title":"Name","description":"Name of the borrower or 'drawee'.","maxLength":200,"type":"string"}}},{"type":"object","allOf":[{"title":"Legal Person","required":["cnpj","nome"],"type":"object","properties":{"cnpj":{"allOf":[{"title":"CNPJ","pattern":"/^\\d{14}$/","type":"string"},{"description":"CNPJ of the borrower or 'drawee'."}]},"nome":{"title":"Name","description":"Name of the borrower or 'drawee'.","maxLength":200,"type":"string"}}},{"type":"object","properties":{"nomeFantasia":{"title":"Fantasy name.","description":"Fantasy name","maxLength":200,"type":"string"}}}]}],"description":"The receiving object organizes the information about the collection creditor.","allOf":[{"type":"object","properties":{"logradouro":{"title":"Logradouro","description":"User address.","maxLength":200,"type":"string"},"cidade":{"title":"Cidade","description":"User city.","maxLength":200,"type":"string"},"uf":{"title":"UF","description":"User UF.","maxLength":2,"type":"string"},"cep":{"title":"CEP","description":"User zip code.","maxLength":8,"type":"string"}},"title":"PixBacenCobDueDateDadosComplementaresPessoa"}]}},"title":"PixBacenCobDueDateRecebedor"},{"type":"object","properties":{"revisao":{"format":"int32","title":"Review","description":"Debt collection review. Always starts at zero. Always varies in increments of 1.","type":"integer"},"status":{"title":"Debt Collection Status","enum":["ATIVA","CONCLUIDA","REMOVIDA_PELO_USUARIO_RECEBEDOR","REMOVIDA_PELO_PSP"],"type":"string"},"txid":{"title":"Transaction Identification","description":"# Transaction Identification\nThe txid field, mandatory, determines the transaction identifier.\nThe purpose of this field is to be an element that enables the PSP of the receiver to present the user with the functionality of payment reconciliation.\nOn pacs.008, is referenced as `TransactionIdentification <txId>` or `idConciliacaoRecebedor`.\nThe txid field is limited to 35 characters in pacs.008.\nIn terms of workflow, txid is read by the payer's PSP application and, after payment is confirmed, it is sent to the SPI via pacs.008.\nA pacs.008 is also sent to the receiver's PSP, containing, besides all the usual payment information, the txid.\nWhen you notice a receiving with txid, the PSP of the receiver is able to communicate with the user receiver, informing that a specific payment has been settled.\nTxid is created exclusively by the receiving user and is under his responsibility.\nThe txid, in the context of representation of a collection, is unique by CPF/CNPJ of the receiver user. It is up to the receiving PSP to validate this rule in the PIX API.\n","pattern":"[A-Z0-9]{26,35}","type":"string"},"valor":{"title":"Amount of collection with calculated maturity returned by payload","description":"All fields indicating monetary values follow the format of ID 54 of the EMV/BR Code specification for QR Codes. The decimal separator is the dot character. The thousand separator is not applicable. Examples of pattern-sticking values: \"1.00\", \"123.99\", \"123456789.23","required":["final"],"type":"object","properties":{"original":{"title":"Value","description":"Original collection value","pattern":"\\d{1,10}\\.\\d{2}","type":"string"},"multa":{"title":"Fine applied","description":"Fine applied to collection","pattern":"\\d{1,10}\\.\\d{2}","type":"string"},"juros":{"title":"Interest applied","description":"Interest applied to the collection","pattern":"\\d{1,10}\\.\\d{2}","type":"string"},"abatimento":{"title":"Abatement applied","description":"Abatement applied to collection","pattern":"\\d{1,10}\\.\\d{2}","type":"string"},"desconto":{"title":"Discount applied","description":"Discounts applied to collection","pattern":"\\d{1,10}\\.\\d{2}","type":"string"},"final":{"title":"Final value","description":"Final value of the collection","pattern":"\\d{1,10}\\.\\d{2}","type":"string"}}}}},{"title":"Base Debt Collection Due date","description":"Attributes common to all Debt Collection entities","type":"object","properties":{"chave":{"title":"DICT receiver key","description":"# Key field format\n* The key field, mandatory, determines the Pix key registered in the DICT that will be used for the billing. This key will be read by the payer's PSP application for consultation with the DICT, which will return the information that will identify the recipient of the charge.\n* The key types can be: PHONE, EMAIL, CPF/CNPJ OR EVP.\n* The format of the keys can be found in the \\\"Formatting the DICT keys in the BR Code\\\" section of the Standards Manual for Pix initiation](https://www.bcb.gov.br/estabilidadefinanceira/pagamentosinstantaneos).","maxLength":77,"type":"string"},"solicitacaoPagador":{"title":"Request to payer","description":"The solicitacaoPagador field, optional, determines a text to be presented to the payer so that he can enter a correlated information, in free format, to be sent to the receiver. This text will be filled in pacs.008 by the payer's PSP in the RemittanceInformation <RmtInf> field. The size of the field <RmtInf> in pacs.008 is limited to 140 characters.","maxLength":140,"type":"string"},"infoAdicionais":{"title":"Additional information","description":"Each respective additional information contained in the list (name and value) must be presented to the
